;;2023 年 10 月 18 日，巴西巴西利亚，前总统雅伊尔·博尔索纳罗在就 1 月 8 日骚乱作证后离开联邦警察总部。路透社/Ueslei Marcelino;
;

;巴西前总统雅伊尔·博尔索纳罗(Jair Bolsonaro)去年在总统选举中以微弱优势输给左翼总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦(Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva)，他的法律风险不断增加，他被禁止参加即将举行的选举，并提高了前景入狱时间。

;

;这位极右翼前陆军上尉在任职之前和四年期间就已经成为警方调查的对象。但他努力破坏人们对巴西投票制度的信心，最终导致巴西利亚数千名支持者于 1 月 8 日发动起义，这只会加剧他的问题。

;

;博尔索纳罗一再否认违反任何法律，并且称针对他的指控是政治对手的政治迫害。

;

;博尔索纳罗目前面临的法律难题包括：

;

;6 月，巴西联邦选举法院 (TSE) ;禁止博尔索纳罗在 2030 年之前担任公职;，因为他在去年的行为年的选举。 2022 年 7 月，他召集大使，对巴西电子投票系统存在漏洞提出毫无根据的指控，七分之五的法官投票判定他滥用权力和滥用媒体罪。

;

;周三，一位一直在调查博尔索纳罗支持者 1 月 8 日叛乱的国会调查机构建议，他和几名盟友面临犯罪团伙、政治暴力、扰乱民主秩序和未遂政变的指控。该调查无权惩罚博尔索纳罗或其他人，但可以提出让他们面临刑事或民事指控的建议。

;

;博尔索纳罗仍然是最高法院领导的至少五项刑事调查的对象。其中包括涉嫌传播有关 COVID-19 疫苗的虚假消息、泄露联邦警察密封调查的细节、干扰联邦警察、传播网上错误信息以及策划 1 月 8 日首都骚乱。

;

;博尔索纳罗和他的前助手也因涉嫌伪造疫苗接种记录前往美国而受到联邦警察的调查。今年 5 月，警方因涉嫌参与该计划而逮捕了前助手 Mauro Cid。

;

;Cid 也是另一起涉嫌诈骗活动的核心人物，博尔索纳罗及其团队涉嫌出售送给他的昂贵珠宝。上个月，在入狱数月后，Cid 同意与联邦警察合作并出狱。

;

;9 月，巴西媒体报道称据称，西德告诉警方，博尔索纳罗已经就推翻选举的法令草案向武装部队指挥官进行了试探。

;;美国总统乔·拜登周三表示，在以色列对巴勒斯坦武装分子发动战争时，华盛顿将向以色列提供自卫所需的一切，他似乎将加沙一家医院发生毁灭性爆炸归咎于巴勒斯坦武装分子。;
;< p>;美国总统乔·拜登在周三的闪电访问期间承诺帮助以色列和巴勒斯坦人，但他将致命的医院爆炸归咎于加沙武装分子发射的一枚错误的火箭，这使得旨在防止战争蔓延的谈判脱轨。

;

;抗议者举行反以色列;示威活动，引发对更广泛不稳定局势的担忧; 中东地区上空吞没加沙地带的火球 ;周二晚间，Al-Ahli al-Arabi 医院;，巴勒斯坦官员称该医院造成 471 人死亡。

;

;他们指责以色列的空袭，而以色列则称这是造成的伊斯兰圣战激进组织火箭发射失败，该组织否认对此负责。

;

;拜登在对以色列进行为期一天的临时访问结束时承诺向以色列提供更多援助，以色列正在轰炸加沙，试图10 月 7 日，哈马斯执政组织在一次跨境袭击中杀害了 1,400 名以色列人，之后将其铲除。

;

;他在谈到医院爆炸事件时表示：“根据我们今天看到的信息，看来”

;

;在华盛顿，白宫国家安全委员会附和拜登的说法，称美国的评估是基于对空中图像、拦截和开源的分析。信息。

;

;阿拉伯领导人取消了与拜登在约旦举行的峰会，以回应医院造成的人员伤亡（他们将此归咎于以色列）。

;

;拜登表示，美国会这样做尽一切努力确保以色列安全，同时敦促以色列人不要被愤怒吞噬，重申绝大多数巴勒斯坦人不隶属于哈马斯。

;

;加沙卫生部表示，3,478 名巴勒斯坦人已被杀害，自 10 月 7 日以来，以色列对被围困飞地的空袭造成 12,065 人受伤。

;

;拜登表示，美国将提供;1亿美元;新资金，用于向加沙和以色列占领的约旦河西岸的巴勒斯坦人提供人道主义援助。

;

;“我们与恐怖分子的区别在于，我们相信每个人生命的基本尊严，”拜登说。如果这一点没有得到尊重，“那么恐怖分子就会获胜。”

;

;在不到八小时的访问中，他还表示，他将要求国会本周为以色列提供“前所未有的”援助计划，尽管没有在众议院;选出一位新发言人;。

;

;拜登面临巨大压力，要求以色列明确承诺让援助从埃及进入加沙，以缓解这个人口稠密的沿海飞地的平民困境。

;

;拜登访问结束时，以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡办公室发布了一份;声明;称以色列将允许食品、水和药品经埃及到达加沙南部。以色列重申，在哈马斯释放 10 月 7 日袭击中扣押的约 200 名人质之前，不会让以色列提供援助。

;

;拜登的中东 ;此行;旨在安抚该地区，但约旦在医院爆炸后取消了原计划与埃及和巴勒斯坦权力机构举行的峰会。相反，他预计在回家的路上从空军一号与约旦和埃及通电话。

;

;医院遭到破坏的情况是;即使按照过去 12 天的标准来看，这也是可怕的;，这给世界带来了无情的画面，这是以色列人在 2023 年第一例被哈马斯枪手杀害的事件。他们的家园，然后是被以色列报复性袭击埋在废墟下的巴勒斯坦家庭。

;

;救援人员在沾满血迹的废墟中搜寻幸存者。加沙卫生部公布的死亡人数为 471 人，但以色列对这一数字提出异议。巴勒斯坦部门发言人阿什拉夫·库德拉 (Ashraf Al-Qudra) 表示，救援人员仍在打捞尸体。

;

;“我们不知道它是什么，但我们知道它能做什么，因为它针对的是被切成碎片的儿童。” ，”医院医生穆罕默德·阿尔-纳卡 (Mohammad Al-Naqa) 说，他说袭击发生时有 3,000 人在那里避难。

;

;以色列上周下令超过 100 万平民进入;加沙北部撤离; 以避免在针对哈马斯据点的袭击中受到打击，流离失所的巴勒斯坦人面临着日益恶化的人道主义危机。

;

;;以色列的近期战略;是摧毁加沙的基础设施，甚至不惜造成大量平民伤亡，将飞地人民推向埃及边境，炸毁迷宫般的地下隧道来追击哈马斯。

;

;邻国埃及和;约旦;坚决拒绝巴勒斯坦难民可以进入其领土的想法。埃及总统阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西和被占领西岸的巴勒斯坦领导人周三谴责;“红线”; 这是无法逾越的。

;

;从联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯到俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京，世界各国领导人都在声明中谴责了加沙医院爆炸事件，但避免提及责任人。

;

;爆炸在整个中东地区引发了;愤怒;。;

;巴勒斯坦官员表示，以色列军队开枪打死两人拉马拉附近的;巴勒斯坦青少年;在广泛的抗议活动期间，约旦河西岸发生了大规模的抗议活动。

;

;以色列与黎巴嫩边境发生了新的冲突，这是自 2006 年上次全面战争以来伊朗支持的真主党运动与以色列之间最致命的暴力事件的一部分。称其两名战士被杀。

;周三，巴西国会对数千名雅伊尔·博索纳罗支持者发起的 1 月 8 日起义进行了调查，建议极右翼分子前总统和他的一些最亲密的盟友被指控犯有未遂政变和其他罪行。

;

;在听取证人的证词并调查围绕巴西利亚政府大楼入侵事件的几个月后，就在左翼总统当选几天后路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦上任后，立法者批准了参议员埃利齐安·伽马的最终报告。

;

;周二，调查报告员伽马建议博尔索纳罗面临犯罪团伙、政治暴力、扰乱社会秩序等罪名的指控。民主秩序和未遂政变。该调查无权惩罚博索纳罗或其盟友，但可以向检察官提出刑事或民事指控的建议。

;

;议员们以 20 票对 11 票通过了伽马的文本，未经任何修改就通过了该文本。该委员会还建议对其他 60 人提出刑事指控，其中包括博尔索纳罗的一些最亲密的盟友，例如他在上次选举中的竞选搭档、前陆军将军沃尔特·布拉加·内托和前国家安全顾问奥古斯托·海莱诺。

;

;投票后，伽马参议员对记者表示：“国会对反民主行为做出了不容忍的反应。”

;

;“这表明巴西战胜了法西斯主义，战胜了野蛮行径，”她说。

;< p>;国会调查的结果只会增加;博尔索纳罗的法律困境;，这自从他去年不情愿地下台以来，他的业务已经成长。这位前总统一再否认违反任何法律，并称针对他的指控是政治对手的政治迫害。

;

;博尔索纳罗在去年的投票中以微弱优势输给卢拉之前，发起了一场全国性的否认选举运动。因在竞选期间对巴西选举制度的脆弱性提出毫无根据的指控，已被该国联邦选举法院裁定在 2030 年之前没有政治资格。

;

;与此同时，他仍受到至少五项刑事调查由最高法院领导。

;

;他还看到一位亲密的前助手与联邦警察达成了合作协议。据称，毛罗·西德是针对博尔索纳罗的两项备受瞩目的刑事调查的关键人物。警方正在调查他和他的团队是否伪造了他的 COVID-19 疫苗接种记录以进入美国，并且还在调查他们非法出售沙特政府赠送给他的政府的昂贵珠宝的指控。

;

;

;

;

;;Republican Jim Jordan came up short in a first vote for his bid for speaker of the US House of Representatives, raising questions about his prospects for winning the job. Here are four things you should know about the conservative firebrand and a close ally of former President Donald Trump.;
;

;Outspoken conservative ;Jim Jordan; sought more time to bolster his faltering bid for the top job in the US House of Representatives after losing a second vote on Wednesday, while his fellow Republicans considered a backup option for the leaderless chamber.

;

;Jordan, who was endorsed by Donald Trump, for a second straight day fell short of the 217 votes needed to fill the ;vacant speaker's chair;, as 22 Republicans and all 212 Democrats voted against him.

;

;He said he would not make another attempt until Thursday at the earliest. "I think there will be a vote tomorrow," he told reporters.

;

;That would be the third consecutive day of voting on Jordan's bid, ousted Speaker Kevin McCarthy took four days - and 15 rounds of voting - to win the gavel in January.

;

;The House is now in its 16th day without a leader, which has left Congress unable to respond to the wars in the Middle East and Ukraine, or to take action to head off a partial government shutdown which will begin in a month without congressional action.

;

;Jordan's vote total of 199 was less than the 200 Republican votes he secured on Tuesday. That is also fewer votes than McCarthy secured in any of the rounds of voting he endured over before being elected speaker.

;

;Republicans who control the chamber by a narrow 221-212 majority have been ;unable to unite; behind a speaker candidate since a small faction of them ;ousted McCarthy; on Oct. 3. Before that, they took Washington to the brink of a government shutdown and the edge of default.

;

;"It's just painfully obvious that what a lot of our people want to do we can't do," said Republican Representative Steve Womack, who voted against Jordan. "We'd like to elect a speaker and we can't even do that."

;

;Other Republicans said it was time to consider a fallback option that would give increased power to Representative Patrick McHenry, who has been temporarily filling the speaker's chair.

;

;"I don't see the outcome changing," Representative Mike Lawler told reporters. "We need to empower Patrick McHenry to serve as temporary speaker so that we can do the work of the American people."

;

;That idea has been floated by Republicans and Democrats, as well as two former Republican speakers, Newt Gingrich and John Boehner.

;

;It could also buy more time for Jordan to line up support for the job after that point.

;

;Democrats, whose support would likely be crucial, have made clear they want Jordan, a driving force behind multiple government shutdowns, out of the picture.

;

;"Our preference is to reopen the House in a bipartisan way so we can govern in an enlightened way, moving forward," House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries said.

;

;One small sign of the uncertainty plaguing the Republicans played out in a Capitol conference room, where staff had ordered pizza for a party meeting that never occurred, leaving them to hand it out to workers.

;

;Jordan's supporters say he would be an effective advocate for advancing conservative priorities in Washington, where Democrats control the White House and the Senate.

;

;"I don't think anybody in here on any issue of any substance would have to guess where Jim Jordan is going to stand.他不欺骗。他不掩饰。 He simply tells you straight up," Republican Representative Tom Cole said as he nominated Jordan for speaker ahead of the vote.

;

;But other Republicans have voted against him for a variety of reasons, including his positions on taxes, spending and disaster aid, and the strong-arm tactics of his supporters.

;

;"Intimidation and threats will not change my position," Republican Representative Kay Granger, who oversees spending legislation as chair of the Appropriations Committee, said on social media after voting twice against Jordan.

;

;New ;Republican alternatives; aside from McHenry could also emerge if Jordan does not pick up support. Republicans who opposed Jordan voted for 10 different candidates, including Boehner and two others who no longer serve in Congress.

;

;Jordan, a former wrestling coach, is a close ally of ;former President Trump; and a founder of the far-right House Freedom Caucus.

;

;Unlike previous House leaders, who gained influence by raising money and building broad coalitions, Jordan has made his name as a vocal leader of the party's hard right, tangling with Democrats and Republicans alike.

;

;He helped drive Republican Boehner into retirement in 2015 and advocated for government shutdowns in 2013 and 2018.

;

;A congressional investigation found that Jordan was a "significant player" in Trump's attempts to overturn Democrat Joe Biden's 2020 election win.

;

;As chair of the House Judiciary Committee, he has led investigations into Biden's administration and is a driving force in an impeachment inquiry of the president that Democrats say is baseless.

;Jordan, a former wrestling coach, is a close ally of ;former President Trump; and a founder of the far-right House Freedom Caucus.

;

;Unlike previous House leaders, who gained influence by raising money and building broad coalitions, Jordan has made his name as a vocal leader of the party's hard right, tangling with Democrats and Republicans alike.

;

;He helped drive Republican Boehner into retirement in 2015 and advocated for government shutdowns in 2013 and 2018.

;

;A congressional investigation found that Jordan was a "significant player" in Trump's attempts to overturn Democrat Joe Biden's 2020 election win.

;

;As chair of the House Judiciary Committee, he has led investigations into Biden's administration and is a driving force in an impeachment inquiry of the president that Democrats say is baseless.

;US President Joe Biden ;arrived; in Israel after an attack on a hospital in the Gaza Strip derailed plans for a diplomatic summit with Arab leaders as the Israel-Hamas conflict continued unabated.

;

;Adding to headwinds, Nvidia ;revealed; details regarding the extent to which US restrictions on chip exports to China could potentially affect its sales.

;

;"The lack of certainty around the potential for escalation in the Middle East has a direct relationship with oil, which has downstream implications and could impact earnings," said Greg Bassuk, chief executive at AXS Investments in New York.

;

;"Investors have moved to a risk-off mentality on the combination of the war in Israel, uncertainty around chips and earnings, and Fed policy all taken together," Bassuk added. "These themes will be the investor narrative for the upcoming days, resulting in this see-saw market of ups and downs."

;

;A string of ;quarterly profit beats;, specifically from ;Morgan Stanley; ;(MS.N); and Procter & Gamble ;(PG.N);, along with a ;sharp rebound; in US housing starts, failed to stir much upside sentiment.

;European stocks ;slid;, ending down 1.1% due to the deepening fears over the Middle East conflict and as a downbeat forecast for the semiconductor sector weighed on sentiment.

;Oil prices ;advanced; as the mounting strife in the Middle East appeared to pose a growing threat to supply.

;US crude rose 1.92% to settle at $88.32 per barrel, while Brent settled at $91.50 per barrel, up 1.78% on the day.
